intro: Hieracium orthobrachion, commonly known as the broad-bracted hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium orthobrachion is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators.
